title: Create session
description:
---
group:
  - Realtime
---
Create an ephemeral API token for use in client-side applications with the
Realtime API. Can be configured with the same session parameters as the
`session.update` client event.

It responds with a session object, plus a `client_secret` key which contains
a usable ephemeral API token that can be used to authenticate browser clients
for the Realtime API.

tabs.title: bash
tabs.code:
curl -X POST https://api.openai.com/v1/realtime/sessions \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "model": "gpt-4o-realtime-preview",
    "modalities": ["audio", "text"],
    "instructions": "You are a friendly assistant."
  }'

{
  "id": "sess_001",
  "object": "realtime.session",
  "model": "gpt-4o-realtime-preview",
  "modalities": ["audio", "text"],
  "instructions": "You are a friendly assistant.",
  "voice": "alloy",
  "input_audio_format": "pcm16",
  "output_audio_format": "pcm16",
  "input_audio_transcription": {
      "model": "whisper-1"
  },
  "turn_detection": null,
  "tools": [],
  "tool_choice": "none",
  "temperature": 0.7,
  "max_response_output_tokens": 200,
  "client_secret": {
    "value": "ek_abc123", 
    "expires_at": 1234567890
  }
}

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: model
properties.description: The Realtime model used for this session.

properties.name: instructions
properties.description:
The default system instructions (i.e. system message) prepended to model  calls. This field allows the client to guide the model on desired  responses. The model can be instructed on response content and format,  (e.g. "be extremely succinct", "act friendly", "here are examples of good  responses") and on audio behavior (e.g. "talk quickly", "inject emotion  into your voice", "laugh frequently"). The instructions are not guaranteed  to be followed by the model, but they provide guidance to the model on the desired behavior.

Note that the server sets default instructions which will be used if this  field is not set and are visible in the `session.created` event at the  start of the session.

properties.name: voice
properties.description:
The voice the model uses to respond. Voice cannot be changed during the 
session once the model has responded with audio at least once. Current 
voice options are `alloy`, `ash`, `ballad`, `coral`, `echo`, `fable`,
`onyx`, `nova`, `sage`, `shimmer`, and `verse`.

properties.name: input_audio_format
properties.description:
The format of input audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.
For `pcm16`, input audio must be 16-bit PCM at a 24kHz sample rate, 
single channel (mono), and little-endian byte order.

properties.name: output_audio_format
properties.description:
The format of output audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.
For `pcm16`, output audio is sampled at a rate of 24kHz.

properties.name: input_audio_transcription
properties.description: Configuration for input audio transcription, defaults to off and can be  set to `null` to turn off once on. Input audio transcription is not native to the model, since the model consumes audio directly. Transcription runs  asynchronously through [the /audio/transcriptions endpoint](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/audio/createTranscription) and should be treated as guidance of input audio content rather than precisely what the model heard. The client can optionally set the language and prompt for transcription, these offer additional guidance to the transcription service.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model to use for transcription, current options are `gpt-4o-transcribe`, `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe`, and `whisper-1`.

properties.name: language
properties.description:
The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in
[ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `en`) format
will improve accuracy and latency.

properties.name: prompt
properties.description:
An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio
segment.
For `whisper-1`, the [prompt is a list of keywords](/docs/guides/speech-to-text#prompting).
For `gpt-4o-transcribe` models, the prompt is a free text string, for example "expect words related to technology".

properties.name: turn_detection
properties.description:
Configuration for turn detection, ether Server VAD or Semantic VAD. This can be set to `null` to turn off, in which case the client must manually trigger model response.
Server VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.
Semantic VAD is more advanced and uses a turn detection model (in conjuction with VAD) to semantically estimate whether the user has finished speaking, then dynamically sets a timeout based on this probability. For example, if user audio trails off with "uhhm", the model will score a low probability of turn end and wait longer for the user to continue speaking. This can be useful for more natural conversations, but may have a higher latency.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of turn detection.

properties.name: eagerness
properties.description: Used only for `semantic_vad` mode. The eagerness of the model to respond. `low` will wait longer for the user to continue speaking, `high` will respond more quickly. `auto` is the default and is equivalent to `medium`.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

properties.name: prefix_padding_ms
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

properties.name: silence_duration_ms
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

properties.name: create_response
properties.description: Whether or not to automatically generate a response when a VAD stop event occurs.

properties.name: interrupt_response
properties.description:
Whether or not to automatically interrupt any ongoing response with output to the default
conversation (i.e. `conversation` of `auto`) when a VAD start event occurs.

properties.name: input_audio_noise_reduction
properties.description:
Configuration for input audio noise reduction. This can be set to `null` to turn off.
Noise reduction filters audio added to the input audio buffer before it is sent to VAD and the model.
Filtering the audio can improve VAD and turn detection accuracy (reducing false positives) and model performance by improving perception of the input audio.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of noise reduction. `near_field` is for close-talking microphones such as headphones, `far_field` is for far-field microphones such as laptop or conference room microphones.

properties.name: tools
properties.description: Tools (functions) available to the model.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the tool, i.e. `function`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function.

properties.name: description
properties.description:
The description of the function, including guidance on when and how 
to call it, and guidance about what to tell the user when calling 
(if anything).

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Parameters of the function in JSON Schema.

properties.name: tool_choice
properties.description:
How the model chooses tools. Options are `auto`, `none`, `required`, or 
specify a function.

properties.name: temperature
properties.description: Sampling temperature for the model, limited to [0.6, 1.2]. For audio models a temperature of 0.8 is highly recommended for best performance.

properties.name: max_response_output_tokens
properties.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls. Provide an integer between 1 and 4096 to
limit output tokens, or `inf` for the maximum available tokens for a
given model. Defaults to `inf`.

definitions.title: Response
definitions.description: The created Realtime session object, plus an ephemeral key

title: Create transcription session
description:
---
group:
  - Realtime
---
Create an ephemeral API token for use in client-side applications with the
Realtime API specifically for realtime transcriptions. 
Can be configured with the same session parameters as the `transcription_session.update` client event.

It responds with a session object, plus a `client_secret` key which contains
a usable ephemeral API token that can be used to authenticate browser clients
for the Realtime API.

tabs.title: bash
tabs.code:
curl -X POST https://api.openai.com/v1/realtime/transcription_sessions \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{}'

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: input_audio_format
properties.description:
The format of input audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.
For `pcm16`, input audio must be 16-bit PCM at a 24kHz sample rate, 
single channel (mono), and little-endian byte order.

properties.name: input_audio_transcription
properties.description: Configuration for input audio transcription. The client can optionally set the language and prompt for transcription, these offer additional guidance to the transcription service.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model to use for transcription, current options are `gpt-4o-transcribe`, `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe`, and `whisper-1`.

properties.name: language
properties.description:
The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in
[ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `en`) format
will improve accuracy and latency.

properties.name: prompt
properties.description:
An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio
segment.
For `whisper-1`, the [prompt is a list of keywords](/docs/guides/speech-to-text#prompting).
For `gpt-4o-transcribe` models, the prompt is a free text string, for example "expect words related to technology".

properties.name: turn_detection
properties.description:
Configuration for turn detection, ether Server VAD or Semantic VAD. This can be set to `null` to turn off, in which case the client must manually trigger model response.
Server VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.
Semantic VAD is more advanced and uses a turn detection model (in conjuction with VAD) to semantically estimate whether the user has finished speaking, then dynamically sets a timeout based on this probability. For example, if user audio trails off with "uhhm", the model will score a low probability of turn end and wait longer for the user to continue speaking. This can be useful for more natural conversations, but may have a higher latency.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of turn detection.

properties.name: eagerness
properties.description: Used only for `semantic_vad` mode. The eagerness of the model to respond. `low` will wait longer for the user to continue speaking, `high` will respond more quickly. `auto` is the default and is equivalent to `medium`.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

properties.name: prefix_padding_ms
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

properties.name: silence_duration_ms
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

properties.name: create_response
properties.description: Whether or not to automatically generate a response when a VAD stop event occurs. Not available for transcription sessions.

properties.name: interrupt_response
properties.description:
Whether or not to automatically interrupt any ongoing response with output to the default
conversation (i.e. `conversation` of `auto`) when a VAD start event occurs. Not available for transcription sessions.

properties.name: input_audio_noise_reduction
properties.description:
Configuration for input audio noise reduction. This can be set to `null` to turn off.
Noise reduction filters audio added to the input audio buffer before it is sent to VAD and the model.
Filtering the audio can improve VAD and turn detection accuracy (reducing false positives) and model performance by improving perception of the input audio.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of noise reduction. `near_field` is for close-talking microphones such as headphones, `far_field` is for far-field microphones such as laptop or conference room microphones.

properties.name: include
properties.description:
The set of items to include in the transcription. Current available items are:
- `item.input_audio_transcription.logprobs`

definitions.title: Response
definitions.description: The created [Realtime transcription session object](/docs/api-reference/realtime-sessions/transcription_session_object), plus an ephemeral key

title: The session object
description:
A new Realtime session configuration, with an ephermeral key. Default TTL
for keys is one minute.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description: Ephemeral key returned by the API.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
Ephemeral key usable in client environments to authenticate connections
to the Realtime API. Use this in client-side environments rather than
a standard API token, which should only be used server-side.

properties.name: expires_at
properties.description:
Timestamp for when the token expires. Currently, all tokens expire
after one minute.

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: instructions
properties.description:
The default system instructions (i.e. system message) prepended to model 
calls. This field allows the client to guide the model on desired 
responses. The model can be instructed on response content and format, 
(e.g. "be extremely succinct", "act friendly", "here are examples of good 
responses") and on audio behavior (e.g. "talk quickly", "inject emotion 
into your voice", "laugh frequently"). The instructions are not guaranteed 
to be followed by the model, but they provide guidance to the model on the 
desired behavior.

Note that the server sets default instructions which will be used if this 
field is not set and are visible in the `session.created` event at the 
start of the session.

properties.name: voice
properties.description:
The voice the model uses to respond. Voice cannot be changed during the 
session once the model has responded with audio at least once. Current 
voice options are `alloy`, `ash`, `ballad`, `coral`, `echo` `sage`, 
`shimmer` and `verse`.

properties.name: input_audio_format
properties.description: The format of input audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.

properties.name: output_audio_format
properties.description: The format of output audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.

properties.name: input_audio_transcription
properties.description:
Configuration for input audio transcription, defaults to off and can be 
set to `null` to turn off once on. Input audio transcription is not native 
to the model, since the model consumes audio directly. Transcription runs 
asynchronously through Whisper and should be treated as rough guidance 
rather than the representation understood by the model.

properties.name: model
properties.description:
The model to use for transcription, `whisper-1` is the only currently 
supported model.

properties.name: turn_detection
properties.description:
Configuration for turn detection. Can be set to `null` to turn off. Server 
VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on 
audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of turn detection, only `server_vad` is currently supported.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

properties.name: prefix_padding_ms
properties.description:
Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

properties.name: silence_duration_ms
properties.description:
Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

properties.name: tools
properties.description: Tools (functions) available to the model.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the tool, i.e. `function`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function.

properties.name: description
properties.description:
The description of the function, including guidance on when and how 
to call it, and guidance about what to tell the user when calling 
(if anything).

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Parameters of the function in JSON Schema.

properties.name: tool_choice
properties.description:
How the model chooses tools. Options are `auto`, `none`, `required`, or 
specify a function.

properties.name: temperature
properties.description: Sampling temperature for the model, limited to [0.6, 1.2]. Defaults to 0.8.

properties.name: max_response_output_tokens
properties.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls. Provide an integer between 1 and 4096 to
limit output tokens, or `inf` for the maximum available tokens for a
given model. Defaults to `inf`.

title: The transcription session object
description:
A new Realtime transcription session configuration.

When a session is created on the server via REST API, the session object
also contains an ephemeral key. Default TTL for keys is one minute. This 
property is not present when a session is updated via the WebSocket API.

properties.name: client_secret
properties.description:
Ephemeral key returned by the API. Only present when the session is
created on the server via REST API.

properties.name: value
properties.description:
Ephemeral key usable in client environments to authenticate connections
to the Realtime API. Use this in client-side environments rather than
a standard API token, which should only be used server-side.

properties.name: expires_at
properties.description:
Timestamp for when the token expires. Currently, all tokens expire
after one minute.

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: input_audio_format
properties.description: The format of input audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.

properties.name: input_audio_transcription
properties.description: Configuration of the transcription model.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model to use for transcription. Can be `gpt-4o-transcribe`, `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe`, or `whisper-1`.

properties.name: language
properties.description:
The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in
[ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `en`) format
will improve accuracy and latency.

properties.name: prompt
properties.description:
An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio
segment. The [prompt](/docs/guides/speech-to-text#prompting) should match
the audio language.

properties.name: turn_detection
properties.description:
Configuration for turn detection. Can be set to `null` to turn off. Server 
VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on 
audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of turn detection, only `server_vad` is currently supported.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

properties.name: prefix_padding_ms
properties.description:
Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

properties.name: silence_duration_ms
properties.description:
Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

title: session.update
description:
Send this event to update the session’s default configuration.
The client may send this event at any time to update any field,
except for `voice`. However, note that once a session has been
initialized with a particular `model`, it can’t be changed to
another model using `session.update`.

When the server receives a `session.update`, it will respond
with a `session.updated` event showing the full, effective configuration.
Only the fields that are present are updated. To clear a field like
`instructions`, pass an empty string.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `session.update`.

properties.name: session
properties.description: Realtime session object configuration.

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: model
properties.description: The Realtime model used for this session.

properties.name: instructions
properties.description:
The default system instructions (i.e. system message) prepended to model  calls. This field allows the client to guide the model on desired  responses. The model can be instructed on response content and format,  (e.g. "be extremely succinct", "act friendly", "here are examples of good  responses") and on audio behavior (e.g. "talk quickly", "inject emotion  into your voice", "laugh frequently"). The instructions are not guaranteed  to be followed by the model, but they provide guidance to the model on the desired behavior.

Note that the server sets default instructions which will be used if this  field is not set and are visible in the `session.created` event at the  start of the session.

properties.name: voice
properties.description:
The voice the model uses to respond. Voice cannot be changed during the 
session once the model has responded with audio at least once. Current 
voice options are `alloy`, `ash`, `ballad`, `coral`, `echo`, `fable`,
`onyx`, `nova`, `sage`, `shimmer`, and `verse`.

properties.name: input_audio_format
properties.description:
The format of input audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.
For `pcm16`, input audio must be 16-bit PCM at a 24kHz sample rate, 
single channel (mono), and little-endian byte order.

properties.name: output_audio_format
properties.description:
The format of output audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.
For `pcm16`, output audio is sampled at a rate of 24kHz.

properties.name: input_audio_transcription
properties.description: Configuration for input audio transcription, defaults to off and can be  set to `null` to turn off once on. Input audio transcription is not native to the model, since the model consumes audio directly. Transcription runs  asynchronously through [the /audio/transcriptions endpoint](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/audio/createTranscription) and should be treated as guidance of input audio content rather than precisely what the model heard. The client can optionally set the language and prompt for transcription, these offer additional guidance to the transcription service.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model to use for transcription, current options are `gpt-4o-transcribe`, `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe`, and `whisper-1`.

properties.name: language
properties.description:
The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in
[ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `en`) format
will improve accuracy and latency.

properties.name: prompt
properties.description:
An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio
segment.
For `whisper-1`, the [prompt is a list of keywords](/docs/guides/speech-to-text#prompting).
For `gpt-4o-transcribe` models, the prompt is a free text string, for example "expect words related to technology".

properties.name: turn_detection
properties.description:
Configuration for turn detection, ether Server VAD or Semantic VAD. This can be set to `null` to turn off, in which case the client must manually trigger model response.
Server VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.
Semantic VAD is more advanced and uses a turn detection model (in conjuction with VAD) to semantically estimate whether the user has finished speaking, then dynamically sets a timeout based on this probability. For example, if user audio trails off with "uhhm", the model will score a low probability of turn end and wait longer for the user to continue speaking. This can be useful for more natural conversations, but may have a higher latency.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of turn detection.

properties.name: eagerness
properties.description: Used only for `semantic_vad` mode. The eagerness of the model to respond. `low` will wait longer for the user to continue speaking, `high` will respond more quickly. `auto` is the default and is equivalent to `medium`.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

properties.name: prefix_padding_ms
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

properties.name: silence_duration_ms
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

properties.name: create_response
properties.description: Whether or not to automatically generate a response when a VAD stop event occurs.

properties.name: interrupt_response
properties.description:
Whether or not to automatically interrupt any ongoing response with output to the default
conversation (i.e. `conversation` of `auto`) when a VAD start event occurs.

properties.name: input_audio_noise_reduction
properties.description:
Configuration for input audio noise reduction. This can be set to `null` to turn off.
Noise reduction filters audio added to the input audio buffer before it is sent to VAD and the model.
Filtering the audio can improve VAD and turn detection accuracy (reducing false positives) and model performance by improving perception of the input audio.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of noise reduction. `near_field` is for close-talking microphones such as headphones, `far_field` is for far-field microphones such as laptop or conference room microphones.

properties.name: tools
properties.description: Tools (functions) available to the model.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the tool, i.e. `function`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function.

properties.name: description
properties.description:
The description of the function, including guidance on when and how 
to call it, and guidance about what to tell the user when calling 
(if anything).

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Parameters of the function in JSON Schema.

properties.name: tool_choice
properties.description:
How the model chooses tools. Options are `auto`, `none`, `required`, or 
specify a function.

properties.name: temperature
properties.description: Sampling temperature for the model, limited to [0.6, 1.2]. For audio models a temperature of 0.8 is highly recommended for best performance.

properties.name: max_response_output_tokens
properties.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls. Provide an integer between 1 and 4096 to
limit output tokens, or `inf` for the maximum available tokens for a
given model. Defaults to `inf`.

title: input_audio_buffer.append
description:
Send this event to append audio bytes to the input audio buffer. The audio 
buffer is temporary storage you can write to and later commit. In Server VAD 
mode, the audio buffer is used to detect speech and the server will decide 
when to commit. When Server VAD is disabled, you must commit the audio buffer
manually.

The client may choose how much audio to place in each event up to a maximum 
of 15 MiB, for example streaming smaller chunks from the client may allow the 
VAD to be more responsive. Unlike made other client events, the server will 
not send a confirmation response to this event.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `input_audio_buffer.append`.

properties.name: audio
properties.description:
Base64-encoded audio bytes. This must be in the format specified by the 
`input_audio_format` field in the session configuration.

title: input_audio_buffer.commit
description:
Send this event to commit the user input audio buffer, which will create a 
new user message item in the conversation. This event will produce an error 
if the input audio buffer is empty. When in Server VAD mode, the client does 
not need to send this event, the server will commit the audio buffer 
automatically.

Committing the input audio buffer will trigger input audio transcription 
(if enabled in session configuration), but it will not create a response 
from the model. The server will respond with an `input_audio_buffer.committed` 
event.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `input_audio_buffer.commit`.

title: input_audio_buffer.clear
description:
Send this event to clear the audio bytes in the buffer. The server will 
respond with an `input_audio_buffer.cleared` event.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `input_audio_buffer.clear`.

title: conversation.item.create
description:
Add a new Item to the Conversation's context, including messages, function 
calls, and function call responses. This event can be used both to populate a 
"history" of the conversation and to add new items mid-stream, but has the 
current limitation that it cannot populate assistant audio messages.

If successful, the server will respond with a `conversation.item.created` 
event, otherwise an `error` event will be sent.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.item.create`.

properties.name: previous_item_id
properties.description:
The ID of the preceding item after which the new item will be inserted. 
If not set, the new item will be appended to the end of the conversation.
If set to `root`, the new item will be added to the beginning of the conversation.
If set to an existing ID, it allows an item to be inserted mid-conversation. If the
ID cannot be found, an error will be returned and the item will not be added.

properties.name: item
properties.description: The item to add to the conversation.

properties.name: id
properties.description:
The unique ID of the item, this can be generated by the client to help 
manage server-side context, but is not required because the server will 
generate one if not provided.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the item (`message`, `function_call`, `function_call_output`).

properties.name: object
properties.description: Identifier for the API object being returned - always `realtime.item`.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
The status of the item (`completed`, `incomplete`). These have no effect 
on the conversation, but are accepted for consistency with the 
`conversation.item.created` event.

properties.name: role
properties.description:
The role of the message sender (`user`, `assistant`, `system`), only 
applicable for `message` items.

properties.name: content
properties.description:
The content of the message, applicable for `message` items. 
- Message items of role `system` support only `input_text` content
- Message items of role `user` support `input_text` and `input_audio` 
  content
- Message items of role `assistant` support `text` content.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The content type (`input_text`, `input_audio`, `item_reference`, `text`).

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text content, used for `input_text` and `text` content types.

properties.name: id
properties.description:
ID of a previous conversation item to reference (for `item_reference`
content types in `response.create` events). These can reference both
client and server created items.

properties.name: audio
properties.description: Base64-encoded audio bytes, used for `input_audio` content type.

properties.name: transcript
properties.description: The transcript of the audio, used for `input_audio` content type.

properties.name: call_id
properties.description:
The ID of the function call (for `function_call` and 
`function_call_output` items). If passed on a `function_call_output` 
item, the server will check that a `function_call` item with the same 
ID exists in the conversation history.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function being called (for `function_call` items).

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The arguments of the function call (for `function_call` items).

properties.name: output
properties.description: The output of the function call (for `function_call_output` items).

title: conversation.item.retrieve
description:
Send this event when you want to retrieve the server's representation of a specific item in the conversation history. This is useful, for example, to inspect user audio after noise cancellation and VAD.
The server will respond with a `conversation.item.retrieved` event, 
unless the item does not exist in the conversation history, in which case the 
server will respond with an error.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.item.retrieve`.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the item to retrieve.

title: conversation.item.truncate
description:
Send this event to truncate a previous assistant message’s audio. The server 
will produce audio faster than realtime, so this event is useful when the user 
interrupts to truncate audio that has already been sent to the client but not 
yet played. This will synchronize the server's understanding of the audio with 
the client's playback.

Truncating audio will delete the server-side text transcript to ensure there 
is not text in the context that hasn't been heard by the user.

If successful, the server will respond with a `conversation.item.truncated` 
event.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.item.truncate`.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description:
The ID of the assistant message item to truncate. Only assistant message 
items can be truncated.

properties.name: content_index
properties.description: The index of the content part to truncate. Set this to 0.

properties.name: audio_end_ms
properties.description:
Inclusive duration up to which audio is truncated, in milliseconds. If 
the audio_end_ms is greater than the actual audio duration, the server 
will respond with an error.

title: conversation.item.delete
description:
Send this event when you want to remove any item from the conversation 
history. The server will respond with a `conversation.item.deleted` event, 
unless the item does not exist in the conversation history, in which case the 
server will respond with an error.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.item.delete`.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the item to delete.

title: response.create
description:
This event instructs the server to create a Response, which means triggering 
model inference. When in Server VAD mode, the server will create Responses 
automatically.

A Response will include at least one Item, and may have two, in which case 
the second will be a function call. These Items will be appended to the 
conversation history.

The server will respond with a `response.created` event, events for Items 
and content created, and finally a `response.done` event to indicate the 
Response is complete.

The `response.create` event includes inference configuration like 
`instructions`, and `temperature`. These fields will override the Session's 
configuration for this Response only.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `response.create`.

properties.name: response
properties.description: Create a new Realtime response with these parameters

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: instructions
properties.description:
The default system instructions (i.e. system message) prepended to model 
calls. This field allows the client to guide the model on desired 
responses. The model can be instructed on response content and format, 
(e.g. "be extremely succinct", "act friendly", "here are examples of good 
responses") and on audio behavior (e.g. "talk quickly", "inject emotion 
into your voice", "laugh frequently"). The instructions are not guaranteed 
to be followed by the model, but they provide guidance to the model on the 
desired behavior.

Note that the server sets default instructions which will be used if this 
field is not set and are visible in the `session.created` event at the 
start of the session.

properties.name: voice
properties.description:
The voice the model uses to respond. Voice cannot be changed during the 
session once the model has responded with audio at least once. Current 
voice options are `alloy`, `ash`, `ballad`, `coral`, `echo`, `fable`,
`onyx`, `nova`, `sage`, `shimmer`, and `verse`.

properties.name: output_audio_format
properties.description: The format of output audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.

properties.name: tools
properties.description: Tools (functions) available to the model.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the tool, i.e. `function`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function.

properties.name: description
properties.description:
The description of the function, including guidance on when and how 
to call it, and guidance about what to tell the user when calling 
(if anything).

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Parameters of the function in JSON Schema.

properties.name: tool_choice
properties.description:
How the model chooses tools. Options are `auto`, `none`, `required`, or 
specify a function, like `{"type": "function", "function": {"name": "my_function"}}`.

properties.name: temperature
properties.description: Sampling temperature for the model, limited to [0.6, 1.2]. Defaults to 0.8.

properties.name: max_response_output_tokens
properties.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls. Provide an integer between 1 and 4096 to
limit output tokens, or `inf` for the maximum available tokens for a
given model. Defaults to `inf`.

properties.name: conversation
properties.description:
Controls which conversation the response is added to. Currently supports
`auto` and `none`, with `auto` as the default value. The `auto` value
means that the contents of the response will be added to the default
conversation. Set this to `none` to create an out-of-band response which 
will not add items to default conversation.

properties.name: metadata
properties.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. 

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

properties.name: input
properties.description:
Input items to include in the prompt for the model. Using this field
creates a new context for this Response instead of using the default
conversation. An empty array `[]` will clear the context for this Response.
Note that this can include references to items from the default conversation.

properties.name: items
properties.description: The item to add to the conversation.

properties.name: id
properties.description:
For an item of type (`message` | `function_call` | `function_call_output`)
this field allows the client to assign the unique ID of the item. It is
not required because the server will generate one if not provided.

For an item of type `item_reference`, this field is required and is a
reference to any item that has previously existed in the conversation.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the item (`message`, `function_call`, `function_call_output`, `item_reference`).

properties.name: object
properties.description: Identifier for the API object being returned - always `realtime.item`.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
The status of the item (`completed`, `incomplete`). These have no effect 
on the conversation, but are accepted for consistency with the 
`conversation.item.created` event.

properties.name: role
properties.description:
The role of the message sender (`user`, `assistant`, `system`), only 
applicable for `message` items.

properties.name: content
properties.description:
The content of the message, applicable for `message` items. 
- Message items of role `system` support only `input_text` content
- Message items of role `user` support `input_text` and `input_audio` 
  content
- Message items of role `assistant` support `text` content.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The content type (`input_text`, `input_audio`, `item_reference`, `text`).

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text content, used for `input_text` and `text` content types.

properties.name: id
properties.description:
ID of a previous conversation item to reference (for `item_reference`
content types in `response.create` events). These can reference both
client and server created items.

properties.name: audio
properties.description: Base64-encoded audio bytes, used for `input_audio` content type.

properties.name: transcript
properties.description: The transcript of the audio, used for `input_audio` content type.

properties.name: call_id
properties.description:
The ID of the function call (for `function_call` and 
`function_call_output` items). If passed on a `function_call_output` 
item, the server will check that a `function_call` item with the same 
ID exists in the conversation history.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function being called (for `function_call` items).

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The arguments of the function call (for `function_call` items).

properties.name: output
properties.description: The output of the function call (for `function_call_output` items).

title: response.cancel
description:
Send this event to cancel an in-progress response. The server will respond 
with a `response.cancelled` event or an error if there is no response to 
cancel.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `response.cancel`.

properties.name: response_id
properties.description:
A specific response ID to cancel - if not provided, will cancel an 
in-progress response in the default conversation.

title: transcription_session.update
description: Send this event to update a transcription session.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: Optional client-generated ID used to identify this event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `transcription_session.update`.

properties.name: session
properties.description: Realtime transcription session object configuration.

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: input_audio_format
properties.description:
The format of input audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.
For `pcm16`, input audio must be 16-bit PCM at a 24kHz sample rate, 
single channel (mono), and little-endian byte order.

properties.name: input_audio_transcription
properties.description: Configuration for input audio transcription. The client can optionally set the language and prompt for transcription, these offer additional guidance to the transcription service.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model to use for transcription, current options are `gpt-4o-transcribe`, `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe`, and `whisper-1`.

properties.name: language
properties.description:
The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in
[ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `en`) format
will improve accuracy and latency.

properties.name: prompt
properties.description:
An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio
segment.
For `whisper-1`, the [prompt is a list of keywords](/docs/guides/speech-to-text#prompting).
For `gpt-4o-transcribe` models, the prompt is a free text string, for example "expect words related to technology".

properties.name: turn_detection
properties.description:
Configuration for turn detection, ether Server VAD or Semantic VAD. This can be set to `null` to turn off, in which case the client must manually trigger model response.
Server VAD means that the model will detect the start and end of speech based on audio volume and respond at the end of user speech.
Semantic VAD is more advanced and uses a turn detection model (in conjuction with VAD) to semantically estimate whether the user has finished speaking, then dynamically sets a timeout based on this probability. For example, if user audio trails off with "uhhm", the model will score a low probability of turn end and wait longer for the user to continue speaking. This can be useful for more natural conversations, but may have a higher latency.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of turn detection.

properties.name: eagerness
properties.description: Used only for `semantic_vad` mode. The eagerness of the model to respond. `low` will wait longer for the user to continue speaking, `high` will respond more quickly. `auto` is the default and is equivalent to `medium`.

properties.name: threshold
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Activation threshold for VAD (0.0 to 1.0), this defaults to 0.5. A 
higher threshold will require louder audio to activate the model, and 
thus might perform better in noisy environments.

properties.name: prefix_padding_ms
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Amount of audio to include before the VAD detected speech (in 
milliseconds). Defaults to 300ms.

properties.name: silence_duration_ms
properties.description:
Used only for `server_vad` mode. Duration of silence to detect speech stop (in milliseconds). Defaults 
to 500ms. With shorter values the model will respond more quickly, 
but may jump in on short pauses from the user.

properties.name: create_response
properties.description: Whether or not to automatically generate a response when a VAD stop event occurs. Not available for transcription sessions.

properties.name: interrupt_response
properties.description:
Whether or not to automatically interrupt any ongoing response with output to the default
conversation (i.e. `conversation` of `auto`) when a VAD start event occurs. Not available for transcription sessions.

properties.name: input_audio_noise_reduction
properties.description:
Configuration for input audio noise reduction. This can be set to `null` to turn off.
Noise reduction filters audio added to the input audio buffer before it is sent to VAD and the model.
Filtering the audio can improve VAD and turn detection accuracy (reducing false positives) and model performance by improving perception of the input audio.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Type of noise reduction. `near_field` is for close-talking microphones such as headphones, `far_field` is for far-field microphones such as laptop or conference room microphones.

properties.name: include
properties.description:
The set of items to include in the transcription. Current available items are:
- `item.input_audio_transcription.logprobs`

title: output_audio_buffer.clear
description:
**WebRTC Only:** Emit to cut off the current audio response. This will trigger the server to
stop generating audio and emit a `output_audio_buffer.cleared` event. This 
event should be preceded by a `response.cancel` client event to stop the 
generation of the current response.
[Learn more](/docs/guides/realtime-model-capabilities#client-and-server-events-for-audio-in-webrtc).

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the client event used for error handling.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `output_audio_buffer.clear`.

title: error
description:
Returned when an error occurs, which could be a client problem or a server 
problem. Most errors are recoverable and the session will stay open, we 
recommend to implementors to monitor and log error messages by default.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `error`.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Details of the error.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of error (e.g., "invalid_request_error", "server_error").

properties.name: code
properties.description: Error code, if any.

properties.name: message
properties.description: A human-readable error message.

properties.name: param
properties.description: Parameter related to the error, if any.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The event_id of the client event that caused the error, if applicable.

title: session.created
description:
Returned when a Session is created. Emitted automatically when a new 
connection is established as the first server event. This event will contain 
the default Session configuration.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `session.created`.

properties.name: session
properties.description: Realtime session object configuration.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the session that looks like `sess_1234567890abcdef`.

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: model
properties.description: The Realtime model used for this session.

properties.name: instructions
properties.description:
The default system instructions (i.e. system message) prepended to model  calls. This field allows the client to guide the model on desired  responses. The model can be instructed on response content and format,  (e.g. "be extremely succinct", "act friendly", "here are examples of good  responses") and on audio behavior (e.g. "talk quickly", "inject emotion  into your voice", "laugh frequently"). The instructions are not guaranteed  to be followed by the model, but they provide guidance to the model on the desired behavior.

Note that the server sets default instructions which will be used if this  field is not set and are visible in the `session.created` event at the  start of the session.

properties.name: voice
properties.description:
The voice the model uses to respond. Voice cannot be changed during the 
session once the model has responded with audio at least once. Current 
voice options are `alloy`, `ash`, `ballad`, `coral`, `echo` `sage`, 
`shimmer` and `verse`.

properties.name: input_audio_format
properties.description:
The format of input audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.
For `pcm16`, input audio must be 16-bit PCM at a 24kHz sample rate, 
single channel (mono), and little-endian byte order.

properties.name: output_audio_format
properties.description:
The format of output audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.
For `pcm16`, output audio is sampled at a rate of 24kHz.

properties.name: input_audio_transcription
properties.description: Configuration for input audio transcription, defaults to off and can be  set to `null` to turn off once on. Input audio transcription is not native to the model, since the model consumes audio directly. Transcription runs  asynchronously through [the /audio/transcriptions endpoint](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/audio/createTranscription) and should be treated as guidance of input audio content rather than precisely what the model heard. The client can optionally set the language and prompt for transcription, these offer additional guidance to the transcription service.

properties.name: model
properties.description: The model to use for transcription, current options are `gpt-4o-transcribe`, `gpt-4o-mini-transcribe`, and `whisper-1`.

properties.name: language
properties.description:
The language of the input audio. Supplying the input language in
[ISO-639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) (e.g. `en`) format
will improve accuracy and latency.

properties.name: prompt
properties.description:
An optional text to guide the model's style or continue a previous audio
segment.
For `whisper-1`, the [prompt is a list of keywords](/docs/guides/speech-to-text#prompting).
For `gpt-4o-transcribe` models, the prompt is a free text string, for example "expect words related to technology".

For example, if user audio trails off with "uhhm", the model will score a low probability of turn end and wait longer for the user to continue speaking. properties.name: tools
properties.description: Tools (functions) available to the model.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the tool, i.e. `function`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function.

properties.name: description
properties.description:
The description of the function, including guidance on when and how 
to call it, and guidance about what to tell the user when calling 
(if anything).

properties.name: parameters
properties.description: Parameters of the function in JSON Schema.

properties.name: tool_choice
properties.description:
How the model chooses tools. Options are `auto`, `none`, `required`, or 
specify a function.

properties.name: temperature
properties.description: Sampling temperature for the model, limited to [0.6, 1.2]. For audio models a temperature of 0.8 is highly recommended for best performance.

properties.name: max_response_output_tokens
properties.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls. Provide an integer between 1 and 4096 to
limit output tokens, or `inf` for the maximum available tokens for a
given model. Defaults to `inf`.

title: session.updated
description:
Returned when a session is updated with a `session.update` event, unless 
there is an error.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `session.updated`.

properties.name: session
properties.description: Realtime session object configuration.

properties.name: id
properties.description: Unique identifier for the session that looks like `sess_1234567890abcdef`.

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model can respond with. To disable audio,
set this to ["text"].

properties.name: model
properties.description: The Realtime model used for this session.

properties.name: instructions
properties.description:

title: conversation.created
description: Returned when a conversation is created. Emitted right after session creation.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.created`.

properties.name: conversation
properties.description: The conversation resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the conversation.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, must be `realtime.conversation`.

title: conversation.item.created
description:
Returned when a conversation item is created. There are several scenarios that produce this event:
  - The server is generating a Response, which if successful will produce 
    either one or two Items, which will be of type `message` 
    (role `assistant`) or type `function_call`.
  - The input audio buffer has been committed, either by the client or the 
    server (in `server_vad` mode). The server will take the content of the 
    input audio buffer and add it to a new user message Item.
  - The client has sent a `conversation.item.create` event to add a new Item 
    to the Conversation.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.item.created`.

properties.name: previous_item_id
properties.description:
The ID of the preceding item in the Conversation context, allows the 
client to understand the order of the conversation.

properties.name: item
properties.description: The item to add to the conversation.

properties.name: id
properties.description:
The unique ID of the item, this can be generated by the client to help 
manage server-side context, but is not required because the server will 
generate one if not provided.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the item (`message`, `function_call`, `function_call_output`).

properties.name: object
properties.description: Identifier for the API object being returned - always `realtime.item`.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
The status of the item (`completed`, `incomplete`). These have no effect 
on the conversation, but are accepted for consistency with the 
`conversation.item.created` event.

properties.name: role
properties.description:
The role of the message sender (`user`, `assistant`, `system`), only 
applicable for `message` items.

properties.name: content
properties.description:
The content of the message, applicable for `message` items. 
- Message items of role `system` support only `input_text` content
- Message items of role `user` support `input_text` and `input_audio` 
  content
- Message items of role `assistant` support `text` content.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The content type (`input_text`, `input_audio`, `item_reference`, `text`).

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text content, used for `input_text` and `text` content types.

properties.name: id
properties.description:
ID of a previous conversation item to reference (for `item_reference`

manage server-side context, but is not required because the server will 
generate one if not provided.

properties.name: type

title: conversation.item.input_audio_transcription.completed
description:
This event is the output of audio transcription for user audio written to the 
user audio buffer. Transcription begins when the input audio buffer is 
committed by the client or server (in `server_vad` mode). Transcription runs 
asynchronously with Response creation, so this event may come before or after 
the Response events.

Realtime API models accept audio natively, and thus input transcription is a 
separate process run on a separate ASR (Automatic Speech Recognition) model, 
currently always `whisper-1`. Thus the transcript may diverge somewhat from 
the model's interpretation, and should be treated as a rough guide.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The event type, must be
`conversation.item.input_audio_transcription.completed`.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the user message item containing the audio.

properties.name: content_index
properties.description: The index of the content part containing the audio.

properties.name: transcript
properties.description: The transcribed text.

properties.name: logprobs
properties.description: The log probabilities of the transcription.

properties.name: items
properties.description: A log probability object.

properties.name: token
properties.description: The token that was used to generate the log probability.

properties.name: logprob
properties.description: The log probability of the token.

properties.name: bytes
properties.description: The bytes that were used to generate the log probability.

title: conversation.item.input_audio_transcription.delta
description: Returned when the text value of an input audio transcription content part is updated.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.item.input_audio_transcription.delta`.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the item.

properties.name: content_index
properties.description: The index of the content part in the item's content array.

properties.name: delta
properties.description: The text delta.

properties.name: logprobs
properties.description: The log probabilities of the transcription.

properties.name: items
properties.description: A log probability object.

properties.name: token
properties.description: The token that was used to generate the log probability.

properties.name: logprob
properties.description: The log probability of the token.

properties.name: bytes
properties.description: The bytes that were used to generate the log probability.

title: conversation.item.input_audio_transcription.failed
description:
Returned when input audio transcription is configured, and a transcription 
request for a user message failed. These events are separate from other 
`error` events so that the client can identify the related Item.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The event type, must be
`conversation.item.input_audio_transcription.failed`.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the user message item.

properties.name: content_index
properties.description: The index of the content part containing the audio.

properties.name: error
properties.description: Details of the transcription error.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of error.

properties.name: code
properties.description: Error code, if any.

properties.name: message
properties.description: A human-readable error message.

properties.name: param
properties.description: Parameter related to the error, if any.

title: conversation.item.truncated
description:
Returned when an earlier assistant audio message item is truncated by the 
client with a `conversation.item.truncate` event. This event is used to 
synchronize the server's understanding of the audio with the client's playback.

This action will truncate the audio and remove the server-side text transcript 
to ensure there is no text in the context that hasn't been heard by the user.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.item.truncated`.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the assistant message item that was truncated.

properties.name: content_index
properties.description: The index of the content part that was truncated.

properties.name: audio_end_ms
properties.description: The duration up to which the audio was truncated, in milliseconds.

title: conversation.item.deleted
description:
Returned when an item in the conversation is deleted by the client with a 
`conversation.item.delete` event. This event is used to synchronize the 
server's understanding of the conversation history with the client's view.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `conversation.item.deleted`.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the item that was deleted.

title: input_audio_buffer.committed
description:
Returned when an input audio buffer is committed, either by the client or 
automatically in server VAD mode. The `item_id` property is the ID of the user
message item that will be created, thus a `conversation.item.created` event 
will also be sent to the client.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `input_audio_buffer.committed`.

properties.name: previous_item_id
properties.description: The ID of the preceding item after which the new item will be inserted.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the user message item that will be created.

title: input_audio_buffer.cleared
description:
Returned when the input audio buffer is cleared by the client with a 
`input_audio_buffer.clear` event.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `input_audio_buffer.cleared`.

title: input_audio_buffer.speech_started
description:
Sent by the server when in `server_vad` mode to indicate that speech has been 
detected in the audio buffer. This can happen any time audio is added to the 
buffer (unless speech is already detected). The client may want to use this 
event to interrupt audio playback or provide visual feedback to the user. 

The client should expect to receive a `input_audio_buffer.speech_stopped` event 
when speech stops. The `item_id` property is the ID of the user message item 
that will be created when speech stops and will also be included in the 
`input_audio_buffer.speech_stopped` event (unless the client manually commits 
the audio buffer during VAD activation).

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `input_audio_buffer.speech_started`.

properties.name: audio_start_ms
properties.description:
Milliseconds from the start of all audio written to the buffer during the 
session when speech was first detected. This will correspond to the 
beginning of audio sent to the model, and thus includes the 
`prefix_padding_ms` configured in the Session.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the user message item that will be created when speech stops.

title: input_audio_buffer.speech_stopped
description:
Returned in `server_vad` mode when the server detects the end of speech in 
the audio buffer. The server will also send an `conversation.item.created` 
event with the user message item that is created from the audio buffer.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `input_audio_buffer.speech_stopped`.

properties.name: audio_end_ms
properties.description:
Milliseconds since the session started when speech stopped. This will 
correspond to the end of audio sent to the model, and thus includes the 
`min_silence_duration_ms` configured in the Session.

properties.name: item_id
properties.description: The ID of the user message item that will be created.

title: response.created
description:
Returned when a new Response is created. The first event of response creation,
where the response is in an initial state of `in_progress`.

properties.name: event_id
properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The event type, must be `response.created`.

properties.name: response
properties.description: The response resource.

properties.name: id
properties.description: The unique ID of the response.

properties.name: object
properties.description: The object type, must be `realtime.response`.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
The final status of the response (`completed`, `cancelled`, `failed`, or 
`incomplete`).

properties.name: status_details
properties.description: Additional details about the status.

properties.name: type
properties.description:
The type of error that caused the response to fail, corresponding 
with the `status` field (`completed`, `cancelled`, `incomplete`, 
`failed`).

properties.name: reason
properties.description:
The reason the Response did not complete. For a `cancelled` Response, 
one of `turn_detected` (the server VAD detected a new start of speech) 
or `client_cancelled` (the client sent a cancel event). For an 
`incomplete` Response, one of `max_output_tokens` or `content_filter` 
(the server-side safety filter activated and cut off the response).

properties.name: error
properties.description:
A description of the error that caused the response to fail, 
populated when the `status` is `failed`.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of error.

properties.name: code
properties.description: Error code, if any.

properties.name: output
properties.description: The list of output items generated by the response.

properties.name: items
properties.description: The item to add to the conversation.

properties.name: id
properties.description:
The unique ID of the item, this can be generated by the client to help 
manage server-side context, but is not required because the server will 
generate one if not provided.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The type of the item (`message`, `function_call`, `function_call_output`).

properties.name: object
properties.description: Identifier for the API object being returned - always `realtime.item`.

properties.name: status
properties.description:
The status of the item (`completed`, `incomplete`). These have no effect 
on the conversation, but are accepted for consistency with the 
`conversation.item.created` event.

properties.name: role
properties.description:
The role of the message sender (`user`, `assistant`, `system`), only 
applicable for `message` items.

properties.name: content
properties.description:
The content of the message, applicable for `message` items. 
- Message items of role `system` support only `input_text` content
- Message items of role `user` support `input_text` and `input_audio` 
  content
- Message items of role `assistant` support `text` content.

properties.name: type
properties.description: The content type (`input_text`, `input_audio`, `item_reference`, `text`).

properties.name: text
properties.description: The text content, used for `input_text` and `text` content types.

properties.name: id
properties.description:
ID of a previous conversation item to reference (for `item_reference`
content types in `response.create` events). These can reference both
client and server created items.

properties.name: audio
properties.description: Base64-encoded audio bytes, used for `input_audio` content type.

properties.name: transcript
properties.description: The transcript of the audio, used for `input_audio` content type.

properties.name: call_id
properties.description:
The ID of the function call (for `function_call` and 
`function_call_output` items). If passed on a `function_call_output` 
item, the server will check that a `function_call` item with the same 
ID exists in the conversation history.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the function being called (for `function_call` items).

properties.name: arguments
properties.description: The arguments of the function call (for `function_call` items).

properties.name: output
properties.description: The output of the function call (for `function_call_output` items).

properties.name: metadata
properties.description:
Set of 16 key-value pairs that can be attached to an object. This can be
useful for storing additional information about the object in a structured
format, and querying for objects via API or the dashboard. 

Keys are strings with a maximum length of 64 characters. Values are strings
with a maximum length of 512 characters.

properties.name: usage
properties.description:
Usage statistics for the Response, this will correspond to billing. A 
Realtime API session will maintain a conversation context and append new 
Items to the Conversation, thus output from previous turns (text and 
audio tokens) will become the input for later turns.

properties.name: total_tokens
properties.description:
The total number of tokens in the Response including input and output 
text and audio tokens.

properties.name: input_tokens
properties.description:
The number of input tokens used in the Response, including text and 
audio tokens.

properties.name: output_tokens
properties.description:
The number of output tokens sent in the Response, including text and 
audio tokens.

properties.name: input_token_details
properties.description: Details about the input tokens used in the Response.

properties.name: cached_tokens
properties.description: The number of cached tokens used in the Response.

properties.name: text_tokens
properties.description: The number of text tokens used in the Response.

properties.name: audio_tokens
properties.description: The number of audio tokens used in the Response.

properties.name: output_token_details
properties.description: Details about the output tokens used in the Response.

properties.name: text_tokens
properties.description: The number of text tokens used in the Response.

properties.name: audio_tokens
properties.description: The number of audio tokens used in the Response.

properties.name: conversation_id
properties.description:
Which conversation the response is added to, determined by the `conversation`
field in the `response.create` event. If `auto`, the response will be added to
the default conversation and the value of `conversation_id` will be an id like
`conv_1234`. If `none`, the response will not be added to any conversation and
the value of `conversation_id` will be `null`. If responses are being triggered
by server VAD, the response will be added to the default conversation, thus
the `conversation_id` will be an id like `conv_1234`.

properties.name: voice
properties.description:
The voice the model used to respond.
Current voice options are `alloy`, `ash`, `ballad`, `coral`, `echo`, `fable`,
`onyx`, `nova`, `sage`, `shimmer`, and `verse`.

properties.name: modalities
properties.description:
The set of modalities the model used to respond. If there are multiple modalities,
the model will pick one, for example if `modalities` is `["text", "audio"]`, the model
could be responding in either text or audio.

properties.name: output_audio_format
properties.description: The format of output audio. Options are `pcm16`, `g711_ulaw`, or `g711_alaw`.

properties.name: temperature
properties.description: Sampling temperature for the model, limited to [0.6, 1.2]. Defaults to 0.8.

properties.name: max_output_tokens
properties.description:
Maximum number of output tokens for a single assistant response,
inclusive of tool calls, that was used in this response.

title: response.done

Returned when a Response is done streaming. Always emitted, no matter the 
final state. The Response object included in the `response.done` event will 
include all output Items in the Response but will omit the raw audio data.

properties.description: The unique ID of the server event.

properties.name: type
